intro: Discocalyx fusca, commonly known as the rusty-leaf discocalyx, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval-shaped leaves that often have a reddish or rusty hue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
